snippet: As big banks keep credit tight and more people have no bank at all, retailers like Costco, Home Depot and Walmart are offering financial products like prepaid cards, loans and even life insurance.
abstract: Retailers like Costco, Home Depot and Walmart, as nation's banks keep credit tight and more people have no bank at all, are offering financial products like prepaid cards, loans and even life insurance; consumer advocates are torn about the growth of this shadow banking industry.

byline.original: By STEPHANIE CLIFFORD and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

lead_paragraph: As big banks keep credit tight and more people have no bank at all, retailers like Costco, Home Depot and Walmart are offering financial products like prepaid cards, loans and even life insurance.

headline.seo: Major Retailers Start Selling Financial Products, Challenging Banks
headline.main: On the New Shopping List: Milk, Bread, Eggs and a Mortgage
headline.print_headline: On the New Shopping List: Milk, Bread, Eggs and a Mortgage
